intro: Quamoclit nationis, commonly known as the national flower of the United States, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Quamoclit nationis is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical significance in American culture.
